node.title: WTA are not convinced Chinese tennis Peng Shuai is safe and well, despite call with IOC president
node.alt: A selfie taken by Peng Shuai holding a Kung Fu Panda doll.
node.description: Concerns continue to grow for Chinese tennis star Peng Shuai's safety following her sexual assault allegation against a former Communist Party official.
node.content:
["Chinese tennis player\u00a0Peng Shuai's video call with the International Olympic Committee (IOC) president does not address or alleviate the Women's Tennis Association's (WTA) concern about her well-being.", "The whereabouts of former doubles world number one Ms Peng have been a matter of international concern for nearly three weeks after she alleged that a former senior Chinese government official sexually assaulted her.", "Before the call with IOC president Thomas Bach, Ms Peng had\u00a0been featured in a series of tweets by\u00a0Chinese state media journalists.", "The images showed Ms Peng at a recent tournament and home with friends.\u00a0", "But they have done little to ease\u00a0concerns.", "\"It was good to see Peng Shuai in recent videos, but they don't alleviate or address the WTA's concern about her well-being and ability to communicate without censorship or coercion,\" a WTA spokesperson said.", "The WTA spokesperson\u00a0said the organisation\u00a0wants an investigation into Ms Peng's allegations.", "\"This video does not change our call for a full, fair and transparent investigation, without censorship, into her allegation of sexual assault, which is the issue that gave rise to our initial concern.\"", "", "
Thomas Bach and two other IOC officials held a video call with\u00a0Peng Shuai.(Supplied: IOC)
", "The IOC said in a statement that Ms Peng held a 30-minute call with its president Thomas Bach, and thanked the Olympic organisation for its concern.", "\"She explained that she is safe and well, living at her home in Beijing, but would like to have her privacy respected at this time,\" the IOC's statement said.", "\"That is why she prefers to spend her time with friends and family right now.", "\"Nevertheless, she will continue to be involved in tennis, the sport she loves so much.\"", "
Online disappearance
", "On November 2, Ms Peng posted on Chinese social media that former vice-premier Zhang Gaoli had sexually assaulted her several years ago.", "The post was quickly deleted and the topic has been blocked from discussion on China's heavily censored internet.", "Neither Mr Zhang nor the Chinese government have commented on Ms Peng's allegations.", "Last week,\u00a0Chinese state media outlet CGTN released\u00a0what it said was an email Ms Peng had sent to the WTA's chairman, Steve\u00a0Simon, denying that she was sexually assaulted.", "Mr Simon\u00a0said he had a hard time believing that Ms Peng herself had written the email.", "Other than the posts shared by Chinese state media journalists, nothing had been posted on Ms Peng's personal social media accounts.\u00a0", "Her account on Weibo no longer allows comments, and no results turn up if people search for her Weibo account.", "
Global outcry\u00a0
", "The concern over Ms Peng comes as global rights groups and others have called for a boycott of the Winter Olympics in Beijing in February over China's human rights record.", "The WTA has also threatened to pull tournaments out of China over the matter.", "France's Foreign Minister\u00a0Jean-Yves Le Drian\u00a0called for Chinese authorities to let Ms Peng speak publicly.", "\"I'm expecting only one thing: that she speaks,\" Mr\u00a0Le Drian said.\u00a0", "He also added there could be unspecified diplomatic consequences if China did not clear up the situation.", "His office did not immediately respond to a request for comment on the IOC's statement.", "The United States and Britain have also called for China to provide proof of Ms Peng's whereabouts.", "Ms Peng's fellow competitors, Serena Williams, Naomi Osaka and\u00a0Novak Djokovic, have all publicly shared their concerns for her well-being on social media.", "Reuters/ABC"]
